paper_abstract: In this paper we present a novel variant of Meyer-Muller's elliptic curve cryptosystem. Unlike Meyer-Muller's proposal and its Chua-Ling's variant, the one presented here is not reducible to Rabin-Williams' cryptosystem. This is formally proven under the assumption that computing half points on elliptic curves defined over the ring Z/nZ is hard when the factorization of n is unknown.
paper_title: A Non-Reducible Meyer-Muller's Like Elliptic Curve Cryptosystem
